column4: I'm trying to get started with GCC, but it keeps saying that my input file doesn't exist. Where do I have to put it so I can just access it via "gcc myfile.cpp"?
Sorry, disconnected. Does somebody know what I'm doing wrong with GCC?
Okay... I tried it with putting sudo in front of the command and it worked.
Seems like you always have to put sudo in front of every command just so
Works better then huh?
don't do that!  only use sudo/gksudo if you *must*
Not even g++/gcc works without sudo
then you did something *very* wrong with your system
Just installed.
please be serious - I installed scores of systems - such a case never occured to me
please pastebin the output of ls -la /home/myacc/Desktop
good - but still it worries me that you seem to "need sudo for everything"  - is that so or was it exaggerated a bit?
I'm new and got confused by something in the terminal making me think the cwd is /Desktop
But gcc tried to run in /home, which I don't have the rights for
So I just tried sudo and it logically worked
oh, ok - yes thats the "solution" - but please keep in mind that it is mainly the reduced rights for a normal user, that makes linux less prone to viruses and such things
so needing sudo should always be sort of an alarm signal: "possible danger ahead"
I know, and it indeed was a bit exaggerated
next security thing: normally the "current directory" is not in the search path for executable programs so you would type ./hw  in the directory
edit .profile in your home directory, it contains settings for PATH, you can use the last 3 lines as example
Thanks a lot
have fun with ubuntu :)
